application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Identification has been based on two (1x black plastic tag and 1x round aluminium) id tags present on the trees at time of inspection and a plan can also be found in submitted report.0707/0059 Birch - Betula utilis ssp. - Reduce crown spreads on the North (over food Village buildings) and South (internal road) sides of the tree by approximately 1.5m, back to suitable secondary growth points. Retaining radial branch spread at approximately 2.5-3m in length. - Crown lift branching to give a clear height of approximately 1.5-2m above the Food Village buildings and approximately 5m from ground level. - Remove deadwood from canopy - Reduce or remove secondary branching to afford a separation clearance of 1.5m from lamppost. 0708/0060 Birch - Betula utilis ssp. - Reduce crown spreads on the North (over food Village buildings) and South (internal road) sides of the tree by approximately 1.5m, back to suitable secondary growth points. Retaining radial branch spread at approximately 2.5-3m in length. - Crown lift branching to give a clear height of approximately 1.5-2m above the Food Village buildings and approximately 5m from ground level. - Remove deadwood from canopy 0709/0061 Birch - Betula utlis ssp. - Reduce crown spreads on the North (over food Village buildings) and South (internal road) sides of the tree by approximately 1.5m, back to suitable secondary growth points. Retaining radial branch spread at approximately 2.5-3m in length. - Crown lift branching to give a clear height of approximately 1.5-2m above the Food Village buildings and approximately 5m from ground level. - Remove deadwood from canopy - Remove 1x low trailing branch on north west side of stems emanating approximately 0.5m from ground level. 0710/0062 Birch - Betula utlis ssp. - Reduce crown spreads on the North (over food Village buildings) and South (internal road) sides of the tree by approximately 1.5m, back to suitable secondary growth points.
